newsitem.title: USA: Cold and wet weather impedes Missouri harvest.
newsitem.headline: Cold and wet weather impedes Missouri harvest.

text.p: Continued cold, wet weather limited harvesting progress in Missouri during the week ended Sunday, according to the state's Agricultural Statistics Service.
Soybeans were 90 percent harvested versus 100 a year ago and the 95 percent average. Harvest in the southeast continued to lag the most at 78 percent complete.
Corn was 92 percent harvested versus 96 a year ago and the 93 average. Corn harvesting in the northwestern district is the least advanced at 86 percent complete.
Sorghum was 92 percent harvested versus 98 a year ago and the 94 average.
Cotton was 88 percent harvested, nearly three weeks behind last year's average and 15 days behind the five-year average of 96 percent.
The winter wheat crop was rated 52 percent good to excellent, 45 percent fair and 3 percent poor.
Topsoil moisture was rated 38 percent surplus, 61 adequate, and one percent short. Pasture and range rated 49 percent good to excellent, 38 fair, 12 percent poor and one percent very poor.
